    • Constructor Detail

      • EventController

        EventController​(EventRepository eventRepository,
                TokenRepository tokenRepository,
                ParticipantRepository participantRepository,
                UserRepository userRepository,
                ReminderRepository reminderRepository,
                AttachmentsRepository attachmentsRepository,
                JavaMailUtil mailUtil)
        using constructor injection (Dependency injection) meaning this constructor is typically not used manually.
        Parameters:
        eventRepository - Repository that holds all events (injected)
        tokenRepository - Repository that holds all tokens of currently active users (injected)
        participantRepository - Repository that holds all participants of events (injected)
        userRepository - Repository that holds all registered users (injected)
        reminderRepository - Repository that holds all reminders (injected)
        attachmentsRepository - Repository that holds all event attachments (injected)
        mailUtil - Utility class used to send mails (injected)

    • Method Detail

      • all

        @GetMapping("/events")
java.util.List<EventDTO> all​(@RequestHeader("userId")
                             java.lang.Long userId,
                             @RequestHeader("token")
                             java.lang.String token)
        Lists all events saved in the database and returns them
        Parameters:
        userId - header that holds the requesting users id
        token - header that holds the requesting users auth token
        Returns:
        List of all Events registered in the database
        Throws:
        UserNotFoundException - if user can't be found in the database
        NoAuthorizationException - if user authentication fails

      • editEvent

        @PutMapping("/events/id={id}")
org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> editEvent​(@PathVariable
                                                                    java.lang.Long id,
                                                                    @RequestBody
                                                                    NewEventDTO event,
                                                                    @RequestHeader("userId")
                                                                    java.lang.Long userId,
                                                                    @RequestHeader("token")
                                                                    java.lang.String token)
        Edit Data of a specific event with the received data from the DTO
        Parameters:
        id - of the event in the database
        event - DTO that holds all relevant data to edit the event
        userId - header that holds the requesting users id
        token - header that holds the requesting users auth token
        Returns:
        Http response if the edit was successful
        Throws:
        UserNotFoundException - if user can't be found in the database
        NoAuthorizationException - if user authentication fails

      • addParticipantsViaEmail

        @PutMapping("/events/id={id}/participants/email={email}")
org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> addParticipantsViaEmail​(@PathVariable
                                                                                  java.lang.Long id,
                                                                                  @PathVariable
                                                                                  java.lang.String email,
                                                                                  @RequestHeader("userId")
                                                                                  java.lang.Long userId,
                                                                                  @RequestHeader("token")
                                                                                  java.lang.String token)
                                                                           throws NoAuthorizationException,
                                                                                  UserNotFoundException
        Add a participant Data of a specific event with the received data from the DTO
        Parameters:
        id - of the event in the database
        email - of the participant you want to add
        userId - header that holds the requesting users id
        token - header that holds the requesting users auth token
        Returns:
        Http response if the edit was successful
        Throws:
        UserNotFoundException - if user can't be found in the database
        NoAuthorizationException - if user authentication fails

      • one

        @GetMapping("/events/id={id}")
EventDTO one​(@PathVariable
             java.lang.Long id,
             @RequestHeader("userId")
             java.lang.Long userId,
             @RequestHeader("token")
             java.lang.String token)
        Get Data of a specific event by including his its id in the request url
        Parameters:
        id - event id in the database
        userId - of the requesting user
        token - of the requesting user, used to validate his login status
        Returns:
        DTO of the event with all information

      • removeParticipant

        @DeleteMapping("/events/id={id}/participants/id={participantId}")
org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> removeParticipant​(@PathVariable
                                                                            java.lang.Long id,
                                                                            @PathVariable
                                                                            java.lang.Long participantId,
                                                                            @RequestHeader("userId")
                                                                            java.lang.Long userId,
                                                                            @RequestHeader("token")
                                                                            java.lang.String token)
        Remove Participant from Event
        Parameters:
        id - event id of the user is participating in
        participantId - userId of the participant to remove
        userId - of the requesting user
        token - of the requesting user, used to validate his login status

      • validateParticipants

        boolean validateParticipants​(java.lang.Long eventId,
                             java.lang.Long userId,
                             java.lang.String token)
        Validates User to grant them access to Events, based on his admin role or his participation in the event
        Parameters:
        eventId - of the event that the client wants to access
        userId - of the requesting user
        token - of the requesting user, used to validate his login status
        Returns:
        true if the given userId and token match a tokenEntity in the database and the accessing user is accessing an event he is participating or is an admin, false otherwise;
